Detailed Description

This class implements a reference to a PyObject *.

The reference may be used in the way that an ordinary reference to a pointer is, i.e. it can be converted into the underlying object, it can be derferenced as using the * and -> operators, and it can be assigned to, replacing the underlying object.

When you take the address of it with &, you do not of course get a PyObject** ... but this is necessary, so that when you dereference that you get something you can still assign to.

It was created to aid classes which have to return non-const 'references' to their member objects, especially where others expect to be able to assign to these references, but where such assignment is a not a simple object copy, but needs to call a function to do it.

Note that when you get a PyObject* out of one of these, by whatever means, then you own the reference to it! (because this may be the only reference to it if it's an object returned by, say, a class which is pretending to be a sequence). Similarly, when you assign a PyObject* to it, a reference is kept (i.e. not borrowed)
